page.title: 10Brecknock Museum.
page.content: Brecknock Museum is housed in the original Shire Hall of the old County of Brecknock built in 1842. In this building the regular Assize Court took place.When the organisation of local goverments took place in 1974, the building became an award winning museum. The original museum became known in 1928. It was opened by Lady Buckland on the 1'st of March. It was housed in the old disused Congregational Chapel in Glamorgan Street. Sir John Conway Lloyd, a distinguished gentleman antiquarian and enthusiasm brought the museum into being. Many local people gave gifts and bequests, one of the first items being the 8'th century canoe dug out of Llangorse Lake and given by Lord Glanusk. The modern museum today has 3 floors and in 1985 was completely redecorated.
